page.title: 09LEISURE SURVEY
page.content: A survey was held to find out how children and their parents spend their leisure time. About 200 families from Crossways Junior School took part. 1. Television viewing is very popular with a vast majority watching T.V. every day. 2. One third of the sample use the local sports centre on at least a weekly basis while only 11% never use it. 3. Over half of the families regularly take part in outdoor exercise varying from jogging to football. 4. The local library is not so popular. 26% use it regularly but as many as 16% never use it at all. 5. Many children play in the street. 70% of junior children do so daily while secondary children no longer choose to do so. Young children are not allowed to play in the street.
